list_definition.definition: tidy; well-ordered, with everything in the right place

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She is very neat and tidy.
He has made a neat job of the repair.

list_definition.definition: (of drink, especially alcoholic) without added water

list_ex_of_english: And with that he divided his circle into neat portions - the kinship groups.
The neat organization of varieties along this continuum demonstrates that the quality of taste is highly salient among growers.
The community involved comprized of two wards and hence had a neat geographical location.
Yet such a neat analysis ignores a startling fact : the mobs were highly selective in their attacks.
Behind this neat isomorphism of ideas, institutions, and book chapters lurks a venerable interpretation of university history.
First, lesions rarely restrict themselves to neat anatomical divisions that researchers can isolate.
The neat division into five discourses, itself somewhat resembling the second, analytical mode, provides clarity but runs the risk of oversimplification.
When the complexities of such linguistic contexts are restored, the neat and tidy political narrative of language endangerment gives way.
